definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to have no basis in fact (idiom)
literary auxiliary particle, comes at the beginning of a sentence
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
(cf Book of Songs) How to fashion an ax handle? You need an ax/fig. to follow a principle/fig. to act as matchmaker
palm fiber/rope of palm fiber/coir (coconut fiber)
the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
to praise sb in his presence
